artist: Artist: Kamisaka Sekka; Artist: Itō Tōzan II
creditline: Gift of the Clark Center for Japanese Art & Culture
description: deep walled ceramic bowl with three wide, short feet at base; decorated with blue flowers with green foliage, and gold, brown, green, and white grasses; white ceramic insert with three prongs included
markings: Seal imprinted on underside of brazier; seal stamped in red near signature on outer wall near bottom; two seals stamped on prong of insert
medium: Ink and color on glazed ceramic
signed: outer side of brazier, near bottom: 雪佳 {Sekka}
text: This ceramic brazier is a relatively small, portable version used to heat water for serving tea in an iron tea pot. This piece, crafted by the master ceramicist Itō Tōzan II, is glazed with an understated natural tone and brings out Sekka’s fresh hydrangea and grass decoration.
title: Brazier with hydrengea design
